p: After correcting for body mass, red knots inoculated during the fueling and migration periods had generally lighter or shorter organs associated with the digestive tract, including gizzard, intestinal tract and liver, than the knots inoculated during the pre- and post-migration periods ( Fig. 2Eâ€“H).Significant differences and p values are given in Table 1. The mass of the pectoral muscles, heart and brain corrected for body mass did not differ between the four groups of knots.
